intro: Bidens cernua var. discoidea, commonly known as the common beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, yellow composite flowers with ray florets and a distinctive, hairy stem. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along streambanks.
